poem:
The Fractured Horizon

The earth spins,  
adrift in silence—  
a chart unmarked,  
  
where once lines  
upon lines spoke,  
now the quiet calls.  
  
Crimson greed,  
cuts deeper still—  
data lost, silenced winds.  
  
An elegy  
to the horizon,  
an echo in the void—  
  
Left to watch  
as unheeded warnings  
dissolve like frost.
